intro: Gilia tenuis, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia tenuis is an annual plant that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
